name: footboard
content:
footboard noun [C]
(ON BED)
Add to word list
Add to word list
a vertical board or similar structure at the end of a bed near your feet: The bed has a wooden headboard and a slatted base, but no footboard. a bed with black tubular steel head- and footboards Compare
headboard
More examplesFewer examplesTheir bed has a wooden footboard.The last time I saw the bag, it was hanging on the footboard of my bed.Only one of the dozen or so basic models of bed in the shop has a footboard.

footboard noun [C]
(ON VEHICLE)
a board for standing on along the side of a vehicle such as an old-fashioned car or tram (= an electric vehicle that transports people, usually in cities, and goes along metal tracks in the road): He jumped off the footboard and started running along the road. Synonym
running board
More examplesFewer examplesThere are rubber strips on the footboard.He was driving a two-wheeled, one-horse delivery cart, with a footboard on the rear upon which the driver stood.Specially fitted cars had extra footboards for the servants to stand on while the car rushed along.
